meanings.definition: To behave in a cowardly or weak manner.
meanings.sent1: He was wimping when faced with a small spider.
meanings.sent2: She is always wimping out of challenges.
meanings.sent3: The cat was wimping around the vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent4: His excuses were wimping away like melting snow.
meanings.sent5: The child's wimping behavior was evident during the thunderstorm.

meanings.definition: The act of behaving in a cowardly or weak manner.
meanings.sent1: Her constant wimping annoys her friends.
meanings.sent2: The wimping of the team cost them the game.
meanings.sent3: The wimping of the puppy over bath time was comical.
meanings.sent4: The wimping of the wind through the trees sounded eerie.
meanings.sent5: The wimping of the student during the presentation was noticeable.
